newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Alter Abadi rise 8.3 pct on its debut.
newsitem.headline: Alter Abadi rise 8.3 pct on its debut.

text.p: Indonesian kaolin miner PT Alter Abadi was traded actively after its debut on Thursday and topping the active list during morning session, brokers said.
After opening at 950 rupiah, the new stock peaked at 1,000 rupiah before easing back to 975 rupiah by the lunchbreak with 31 million shares changing hands, brokers said.
"It was quite a relief that it was finally listed today because previously we had heard talk that the Capital Markets Supervisory Agency (Bapepam) might suspend the listing," a local broker said.
Brokers said buying interest from PT Makindo, who is also the underwriter of the issue, seemed quite strong and it might have helped limit the downside.
They said the talk of possible suspension on the listing was due to recent media reports that National Kaolin Association had asked Bapepam to re-check all information contained in the prospectus.

On Thursday, Bisnis Indonesia daily quoted Bapepam chairman I Putu Gede Ary Suta as saying the body had checked all the information in the prospectus before giving it permission to list on the Jakarta Stock Exchange few months ago.
Alter Abadi listed 398,250,000 shares on the Jakarta bourse, offering 88,919,000 shares to public at 900 rupiah last month.
The firm said in its prospectus proceeds from the sale of 62,574,500 shares would be given to the privately-owned PT Hakim Perkasa Interniaga as a founder shareholder.
Proceeds from the remaining 26,344,500 shares would be used to repay company's temporary loan to PT Hakim Perkasa Interniaga.
